jsonuri package¶

Submodules¶

jsonuri.jsonuri module¶

jsonuri.jsonuri.deserialize(string, decode_twice=True)[source]¶

Converts a URI parameters’ string into a python dictionary

Parameters:
  • string – Serialized URI parameters string to deserialize
  • decode_twice – Whether string should be decoded twice. Should be true is data was produced by this package and sent over the web.
Returns:

Python dictionary with parsed parameters

import urllib.parse

#URL: http://domain/resource?name=John&age=31 or http://domain/resource?name%3DJohn%26age%3D31

>>> string = "name=John&age=31" # or "name%3DJohn%26age%3D31"
>>> deserialize(string)
{'age': '31', 'name': 'John'}
jsonuri.jsonuri.serialize(data, encode=True)[source]¶

Serializes a python dictionary or list into a URI parameters’ string

Parameters:
  • data – Python dictionary or list to serialize
  • encode – If True, the serialized string will be encoded with the urllib.parse.quote_plus method
Returns:

Serialized data string, encoded if encode is True

 
>>> import json
>>> import urllib.parse
>>> serialize(json.loads('{"age": "31", "name": "John"}'))
'age%3D31%26name%3DJohn'
>>> serialize(json.loads('{"age": "31", "name": "John"}'), False)
'age=31&name=John'
